com.example.bot.spring

Class SQLDatabaseEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.bot.spring.DatabaseEngine
      • com.example.bot.spring.SQLDatabaseEngine

  • public class SQLDatabaseEngine
extends DatabaseEngine
    The SQLDatabaseEngine implements functions that communicate with the database and get/update the related data.
    Since:
    2017-11-01

    • Method Detail

      • InitializeNewUser

        public java.lang.String InitializeNewUser(java.lang.String userId)
                                   throws java.lang.Exception
        This method is used to create new user info in our database. Data stored will be needed in order for other functions to work. The data is bound to the userID, which is unique for each user. Return statement for new user and users that have previously used the chatbot will be slightly different.
        Parameters:
        userId - This is the unique user ID generated by Line
        Returns:
        String This returns the result of the initialization
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If userID already exist in user_info table
        java.lang.Exception

      • RemoveUser

        public java.lang.String RemoveUser(java.lang.String userId)
                            throws java.lang.Exception
        This method is used to delete user info in our database. Data stored will be deleted from database. The data is bound to the userID, which is unique for each user. Return acknowledge message to the user.
        Parameters:
        userId - This is the unique user ID generated by Line.
        Returns:
        String This returns the result of the deletion.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If userID does not exist in database.
        java.lang.Exception

      • getInfoState

        public java.lang.String getInfoState(java.lang.String userId)
                              throws java.lang.Exception
        This method is used to get info state in our database for a particular user. Info state is used to determine which information user will be setting the next time they input.
        Parameters:
        userId - This is the unique user ID generated by Line.
        Returns:
        String This returns the current state.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If errors occured in database.
        java.lang.Exception

      • setInfoState

        public void setInfoState(java.lang.String text,
                         java.lang.String userId)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        This method is used to set info state in our database for a particular user. Info state is used to determine which information user will be setting the next time they input.
        Parameters:
        text - This will be the next info_state of the user
        userId - This is the unique user ID generated by Line.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If errors occured in database.
        java.lang.Exception

      • weight

        public java.lang.String weight(java.lang.String text,
                               java.lang.String userId)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        This method is used to set weight (in kg) in our database for a particular user.
        Parameters:
        text - This is the input passed by user.
        userId - This is the unique user ID generated by Line.
        Returns:
        String This returns whether the input is valid and if the weight value has been updated.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If errors occured in database.
        java.io.IOException - If text entered is not a number.
        java.lang.Exception

      • waterInterval

        public java.lang.String waterInterval(java.lang.String text,
                                      java.lang.String userId)
                               throws java.lang.Exception
        This method is used to set water interval (in mins) in our database for a particular user. Value set by this function will be used to determine whether a remind message to be generated.
        Parameters:
        text - This is the input passed by user.
        userId - This is the unique user ID generated by Line.
        Returns:
        String This returns whether the input is valid and if the water_interval value has been updated.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If text entered is not a number.
        java.sql.SQLException - If error in database.
        java.lang.Exception

        Parameters:

      • menu_search

        public java.lang.String menu_search(java.lang.String text)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        This method is used to search for nutrient info for a menu/meal. Nutrient info includes weight, energy, sodium, and fat.
        Parameters:
        text - This is the input passed by user.
        Returns:
        String This returns the nutrients for the input.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If input is invalid.
        java.sql.SQLException - If error in database.
        java.lang.Exception

      • eat

        public java.lang.String eat(java.lang.String text,
                            java.lang.String userId)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        This method is used to record nutrient info in our database for a particular user.
        Parameters:
        text - This is the input passed by user which indicates what they ate.
        userId - This is the unique user ID generated by Line.
        Returns:
        String This returns the nutrient info of the meal and signals user if the intake is too high.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If input is invalid.
        java.sql.SQLException - If error in database.
        java.lang.Exception

      • code

        public java.lang.String code(java.lang.String text,
                             java.lang.String userId)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        This method is used when user refer their friends by entering their code.
        Parameters:
        text - This is the input passed by user which indicates the user that invited them.
        userId - This is the unique user ID generated by Line.
        Returns:
        String This returns if the referral is valid and if coupon has been given to them.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If input is invalid (i.e. not entering a number).
        java.sql.SQLException - If error in database.
        java.lang.Exception

        String This returns if the redeem is good and if they still have any coupons left.

      • GetCouponCount

        public int GetCouponCount(java.lang.String sqlstatement)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        This method is used to get the current total coupon number for a testcase. This is specifically needed for testing if the handling is correct when coupon is greater than 5000. The value will be saved by a variable and set the value again when the testcase is finished.
        Parameters:
        sqlstatement - This is the SQL Statement passed to guranteen test data is in good condition.
        Returns:
        the current total number of coupon given out
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If error in database.
        java.lang.Exception

      • order

        public java.lang.String order(java.lang.String userID,
                              java.lang.String decision)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        This method is used to give recommendation for user. Recommendation includes meal time and meal type.
        Parameters:
        userID - This is the user ID for the user generated by Line.
        decision - A number which decides which option.
        Returns:
        String This returns the next steps/result of the feature.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If input is invalid.
        java.sql.SQLException - If error in database.
        java.lang.Exception
